Perpetrator: Police officers from Pangani Police station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing a youth in Mathare at Mlango Kubwa area. Police say the deceased was a notorious criminal on their radar for months.
He was shot dead when he refused to surrender and instead shot at police indiscriminately. Body taken to City mortuary.
Name: Vinnie

Perpetrator: Police officers ffrom Olmoran police station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing four Samburu adults who had allegedly stolen livestock from Mugie ranch in Laikipia.
Police said the quadruple died on the spot during a shoot-out that happened at the Posta area in Relit village, Kirima sub-county.
Incident was reported to Olmoran police station as a fatal shooting.
Police recovered a G3 rifle with an empty magazine, M16 assault rifle with a magazine of eight rounds, an AK47 assault rifle with an empty magazine and four double pouches of an AK47 from the scene.
 Bodies were taken to Nyahururu county hospital morgue.
Name: Unknown

Description:
According to media reports, Morris Mabior,a Sudanese who sought asylum in Kenya in April 2021 was kidnapped from his Nairobi home along Kangundo road. 
His wife Angelina Aliet, said that five men and a woman trailed her husband from a nearby shop to the house and demanded that she opens the door.
After ransacking the house, the police left with Mabior.
Name: Morris Mabior

Perpetrator: Police officers from Kasarani Police Station
Description:
Police confirmed killing one person in Zimmerman on Thika Super-highway at Kastemill area.
Police say the deceased was armed with a Beretta pistol. He was allegedly carrying a "43’’ flat screen television suspected to have been stolen from a house in Zimmerman.
Police say the deceased defied orders to surrender prompting the officers to shoot him dead.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from kamukunji Police Station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing two people in the capital,Nairobi.
According to police,the deceased killed at Kamukunji near Kwa Viatu area are said to be attacking pedestrians in the morning of the fateful day.
Following the incident, police said one home made firearm capable of firing was recovered, a blood stained knife, mobile phones and six wallets.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police Officers from Dandora Police Station
Description:
Police have confirmed shooting dead unknown man Wednesday morning, January 25, 2023. Police allege the deceased was a most wanted robber also accused of raping women.
According to Nairobi News the deceased who is famous within Dandora estate as he usually wears a mask and is armed with a pistol was shot along a railway line in the estate.
Officers who shot him managed to recover a pistol, knives, and a number of valuable items, including phones which he had stolen from members of the public from him.
A Browning pistol loaded with 13 rounds of 9mm calibre were recovered from deceased.
A Police rain coat, handcuff keys, four mobile phones, two master keys and a dagger were recovered.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from kamukunji Police Station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing two people in the capital,Nairobi.
According to police,the deceased killed at Kamukunji near Kwa Viatu area are said to be attacking pedestrians in the morning of the fateful day.
Following the incident, police said one home made firearm capable of firing was recovered, a blood stained knife, mobile phones and six wallets.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Njiru Police Post, under Kayole Police Station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing two people in Nairobi's Njiru estate on January 17.
The deceased were in the company of  one suspect who managed to escape using a motorcycle. Police say they were planning a robbery on Kangundo road.
"The hawk-eyed officers who were on routine patrol along Kangundo road in an unmarked vehicle, had noticed a suspicious motorbike at Shujaa area whose pillion passengers were preying on their next victim." DCI wrote of their Facebook page.
The deceased allegedly shot at officers upon interrogation. This provoked a shootout killing two on the spot. Bodies were taken to City mortuary.
A firearm serial number KE-AP G0857 loaded with three rounds of 9mm calibre was recovered.
Police claim the ceska pistol had been snatched from a senior officer within Embakasi police station mid last December.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Njiru Police Post, under Kayole Police Station
Description:

Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officerds from Dandora Police Station
Description:
Police have confirmed shooting two young men and Killing them on the spot on January 16 in Dandora.
Police say the two using a motorcycle were stealing valuables from locals and had shot a 33 year old man in the thigh.
Nairobi police boss Adamson Bungei said police recovered the motorcycle, two homemade guns, two empty cartridges and three live bullets.
Bungei said one of the slain suspects was identified as Yutman Mgaza who was a jailbird.
Police launched a man-hunt in the area and caught up with them with the help of locals
Bungei said they recovered the motorcycle, two homemade guns, two empty cartridges and three live bullets.
Name: Yutman Mgaza

Perpetrator: Police officerds from Dandora Police Station
Description: Police have confirmed shooting two young men and Killing them on the spot on January 16 in Dandora. Description: Police have confirmed shooting two young men and Killing them on the spot on January 16 in Dandora. Perpetrator: Police officers from Ruai Police Station
Description: The deceased allegedly died in the hands of police at Kenyatta University Teaching and Referral hospital under unclear circumstances. Police from Ruai are investigating the matter.
Name: Bernard Wandeto Kabungu

Description:
Police have confirmed killing two people suspected of armed robbery in five counties-Uasin-Gishu, Trans-Nzoia, Bungoma, Kakamega and Vihiga.
The deceased were shot dead along Eldoret-Mumias road by detectives from DCI headquarters.
Police claim the deceased were on a motorbike headed to Eldoret from Mumias when they defied orders to surrender and shot at the officers. This  prompted the undercover detectives to shoot and kill them on the spot
The duo are accused of killing three members of the public. An AK-47 assault rifle loaded with 19 rounds of 7.62mm special calibre was recovered from the deceased.
The duo police say were part of a five-man gang that had staged a total of 8 armed attacks targeting businesses in the five counties, between October 22 to December 26,2022 leading to loss of millions of cash. Police say it  lead to an outcry from businessmen.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police have confirmed killing two people suspected of armed robbery in five counties-Uasin-Gishu, Trans-Nzoia, Bungoma, Kakamega and Vihiga.
The deceased were shot dead along Eldoret-Mumias road by detectives from DCI headquarters.
Police claim the deceased were on a motorbike headed to Eldoret from Mumias when they defied orders to surrender and shot at the officers. This  prompted the undercover detectives to shoot and kill them on the spot

Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Pangani Police station
Description:
Police have confirmed killing 22 year old Charles Gitau Mwangi alias Baroda.
They have confirmed the deceased was on the detectives’ radar for the past few weeks.
Police claim he had attacked a woman on her way to work on January 4,2023 at 8 AM at Mlango Kubwa.
Deceased allegedly defied police orders to surrender and instead fired towards them using a home made gun capable of firing.
Police claim a firearm capable of firing, 2 rounds of 9mm calibre, a knife and the stolen mobile phone were recovered from the fallen suspect as two of his accomplices escaped.
Name: Charles Gitau Mwangi

Perpetrator: Police officers from Simba Police Station
Description: According to Citizen TV,the deceased was arrested and locked up at Simba police station in Kilifi on December 31,2022. He was accused of assaulting his friend. The deceased wife claimed she found her husband dead when she had taken food to him at the station. The deceased family led by his father Mr Lewa have disputed the police version that the deceased committed suicide using his underwear. The family has called for thorough a investigation. Coast region police boss Titus Karuri told MV the matter is under investigation and a postmortem report was underway to determine the cause of death.
Name: Isaac Ngombo Lewa

Perpetrator: Undercover detectives from Makadara police station
Description: Police have confirmed shooting dead one person on December 27,2022 in Nairobi, Makadara sub-county. Police claim the deceased and two others who escaped had engaged police in a fierce gunfire fight. A home made firearm loaded with two live rounds of 9mm calibre and a communication gadget imitating a police walkie-talkie were recovered by police. Deceased body was taken to City Mortuary.
Name: Stanley alias Untouchable

Perpetrator: Administration Police Officers at kitaru chiefs office
Name: Franklin Mong’are

Description: Police have confirmed Elvis Baya Thoya was shot dead by police constable David Mukiri F/No 95457 on December 22,2022. Thoya a Bodaboda rider was ferrying Mukiri at around 8 pm along Malindi Mombasa highway after the officer went to buy food. Mukiri was attached to Malindi airport. He shot the deceased thrice after a disagreement. The suspect, Mukiri committed suicide on December 22.
Name: Elvis Baya Thoya

Perpetrator: Police officers from Pangani Police station
Description: Police have confirmed killing the deceased on December 21. Police say together with two of his accomplices the deceased snatched a mobile phone and other valuables from a woman along Muratina-Mathare road.  Members of the public raised alarm attracting the attention of police on patrol from Pangani police station. The deceased tried to attack a police officer who was pursuing him prompting the officer to shoot him dead. Police recovered Three machetes, daggers and other crude weapons. Deceased body was taken to City mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Garissa Police Station
Description: The incident occurred on Tuesday December 13 at around 2030 hours along Daadab-Garissa Highway within the Lago area. Police officers from Garissa police station on patrol shot Shamsa dead. IPOA has taken over investigations.
Name: Shamsa Gulled Abdille

Perpetrator: Meshack Kosgei, a police officer at Bamburi Police station
Description: According to both the Star newspaper and Citizen digital, the deceased was shot dead on December 6 by her husband, Meshack Kosgei. He is a police officer attached to Bamburi police station. The couple was living outside police quarters and their marriage is said to have been rocky. The deceased sustained two gunshot wounds in the thighs and one in the stomach in the presence of the couple's one year old child. Suspect arrested and arraigned.
Name: Emily Musita

Perpetrator: Police  officers from Thika police station
Description:
Police have confirmed the killing of one George Kimani, 22 in Thika Town, Kiambu county, on November 15 by police officers from Thika police station. The deceased family claim their son was innocent and was on his way home when he met his death a few meters from Thika fire station.
Police however say the deceased was armed with crude weapons. Officers claim they recovered two machetes, a homemade firearm and mobile phones suspected to have been snatched from innocent victims.
Name: George Kimani

Perpetrator: A police officer from Buruburu police station
Description:
Nairobi County: A police officer shot dead Stephen Osedo at umoja Estate in Nairobi county after a suspected argument, witnesses said. The officer has since been arrested. Witnesses told police they saw two people argue at about 3 am on 13th November before one of them reached out for his gun and shot the other one in the head, killing him on the spot.
Police were informed and rushed to the scene and found constable Jason Nyamolo attached to Buruburu police station armed with a glock pistol loaded with 14 bullets. He was arrested and placed in custody pending further action. The body was moved to the City mortuary awaiting postmortem and identification.
Name: Stephen Osedo

Perpetrator: Police officers from Thika Police station
Description:
Kiambu County: Police have confirmed shooting dead an unknown man they say was suspected of violently robbing a student in Thika town, Kiambu county, near Gatitu Junction. Police on patrol responded to screams from the victim. 
Police shot dead one suspect who was about to shoot at the officers. He died on the spot from a single bullet.
Police recovered the victim's cell phone from the suspect’s pockets, a sharp machete and a home made firearm carefully tucked in the thug’s genitals.
The student only identified as Onyi was on his way home when he was attacked by the trio. Two managed to escape. Body taken to General Kago morgue in Thika.
Name: Unknown

Location: Shamberere Technical Training Institute, Kakamega County
Perpetrator: Police officers from Kabras police station
Description:
Police have confirmed shooting Collins Ndobi, 25 who died on the spot in Kakamega county at Shamberere Technical and Training Institute the Monday, November 7.
Police from Kabras police station were called to rescue a student who was being attacked by a mob on suspicion of being a thief. Police claim that at the scene, the crowd was violent and attacked them. Police used live bullets to disperse the crowd shooting Collins Ndobi in the head.
Name: Collins Ndombi

Manner of Death: Shot by anti- stock theft officers
Description:
Rift valley police boss Tom Odero has told Missing Voices police killed two people on October 26. 
Three young men attacked Komote area and tried to drive off with 14 donkeys.

Residents alerted police who were on an operation in Laisamisi area.

On reaching Lentert area, police caught up with them and exchange of fire ensued leading to the killing of the two, Rift Valley police boss Tom Odero said.
An accomplice was later arrested by police.

Two AK47 rifles and 26 bullets were recovered from the deceased.
Name: Unknown

Manner of Death: Shot by anti- stock theft officers

Two AK47 rifles and 26 bullets were recovered from the deceased.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police have confirmed shooting dead a foreign journalists Arshad Mohammed Shariff a Pakistani. Police later said it was a mistaken identity during the 10 pm incident in Kajiado county along Kuenia Kamukuru road.
Police were pursuing a missing car KDG 200M but ended up shooting at the journalist's car KDJ 700 F both from the rear and front windscreens. The deceased was shot in the head.
IPOA investigations ongoing. Body taken to Chiromo morgue.
Name: Arshad Mohammed Shariff

Description:
The bodies of the deceased were found dumped at Ndundori forest in Nakuru county.Police reports indicate the trio were youthful and may have been tortured and killed elsewhere before they were dumped in the forest.
A police source who sought anonymity for fear of victimisation told Missing Voices the three were abducted from Nairobi in September by security agents. He did not divulge details.
Missing Voices in September documented enforced disappearances of three young men from Kawangware,Elvis Shemali,Zacheus Mwangi and Eric Mukonyi.
Name: Unknown

Description:
The bodies of the deceased were found dumped at Ndundori forest in Nakuru county.Police reports indicate the trio were youthful and may have been tortured and killed elsewhere before they were dumped in the forest.

Name: Unknown

Description:
Police trailed the deceased using a motorcycle posing as Bodaboda operators. The deceased were also using a motorcycle allegedly to rob pedestrians between Màziwa, Githurai and Zimmerman estate.
The deceased on realisation of a suspicious motorcycle that  was trailing them for long sped off towards a footbridge on Thika road near Car Wash stage.
One of the  deceased tried to shoot at the police officers and that is when police pumped several bullets into their bodies killing them on the spot.
A Bodaboda rider said police called Bodaboda operators officials from within identify the deceased but it was found out that the deceased were not part of their members.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police trailed the deceased using a motorcycle posing as Bodaboda operators. The deceased were also using a motorcycle allegedly to rob pedestrians between Màziwa, Githurai and Zimmerman estate.
The deceased on realisation of a suspicious motorcycle that  was trailing them for long sped off towards a footbridge on Thika road near Car Wash stage.
One of the  deceased tried to shoot at the police officers and that is when police pumped several bullets into their bodies killing them on the spot.

Name: Unknown

Description:
Police confirmed shooting dead two men they suspected of robbing pedestrians in Nairobi county,Yaya Centre on October 5,at 2AM.Officers on patrol responded to an alarm, prompting a chase towards nearby Lenana Road where the suspects abandoned their motorcycle and started escaping on foot.
It was then that the two were shot and killed in the drama. A mini revolver with two bullets and four mobile phones were found on the deceased.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police confirmed shooting dead two men they suspected of robbing pedestrians in Nairobi county,Yaya Centre on October 5,at 2AM.Officers on patrol responded to an alarm, prompting a chase towards nearby Lenana Road where the suspects abandoned their motorcycle and started escaping on foot.
It was then that the two were shot and killed in the drama. A mini revolver with two bullets and four mobile phones were found on the deceased.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Officers on patrol from Githurai police station confirmed shooting dead the duo on October 1 at around 2.45 AM,they confided to Missing Voices.The deceased allegedly were in a group of three young men armed with a pistol and riding on a motorcycle. One escaped with injuries but police fell two.
Police said they recovered 10 rounds of ammunition from the deceased whom they accused of robbing residents.Bodies taken to City mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Officers on patrol from Githurai police station confirmed shooting dead the duo on October 1 at around 2.45 AM,they confided to Missing Voices.The deceased allegedly were in a group of three young men armed with a pistol and riding on a motorcycle. One escaped with injuries but police fell two.
Police said they recovered 10 rounds of ammunition from the deceased whom they accused of robbing residents.Bodies taken to City mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Description: The victim was tortured in public by two men who claimed to be police officers. He died in a private hospital from his injuries inflicted by the alleged police officers.
Name: Alfred King’oina

Description:
Gunmen are reported to have on September 23 abducted Alfred Odhiambo who is yet to be traced after allegedly raiding his house in Maji mazuri area in Mwiki. He is a brother to Kevin Odhiambo who was shot dead at Mihang'o same day.
According to the Nation the  gunmen were captured on a CCTV dressing in bullet proof jackets torturing and harassing Odhiambo with one asking him to produce a gun.
According to a police officer who sought anonymity,he told Missing Voices the abductors were police officers from the DCI.
Name: Alfred Odhiambo

Description:
According to a police officer privy to the incident told Missing Voices in confidence confirmed that Kevin Odhiambo was shot dead by undercover police officers from DCI on September 23 in Nairobi, Mihango following a series of armed robberies in Nairobi. The deceased ís said to be hiring out a gun to commit crimes.
The deceased's girl friend whom the gunmen abducted was freed later the same day at Fedha estate.
The officer confided to Missing Voices that the man at the scene identified as "Paul Kariuki" is a police informer.
The deceased is said to have been shot 36 times.
Name: Kevin Odhiambo

Description:
A CCTV footage obtained by Citizen TV showed several men in police uniform entered Sian apartments in Kawangware at 5:45AM, where they got into Mukonyi house, ransacked it and arrested him. 

They took him away as well as some of his belongings, including mobile phones, laptops and computers.
Name: Eric Mukonyi

Description:
Several unknown men raided Mwangi’s shop in Kawangware Arcade shopping centre, where he was enjoying an afternoon drink with his wife Hellen Wanjiru.

He was handcuffed and whisked away by the men, without an explanation to his wife regarding where he was to be taken.
Name: Zacheus Mwangi

Description: He went missing on September 17 after people dressed in police uniform arrested him. His family has not found him despite making several visits to police stations around the capital.
Name: Elvis Shemali

Description:
According to HAKI Africa police from Eldoro police post arrested Roman Mwacheda on September 15 on suspicion of theft — but four hours later, his family found him dead in a police cell.
Police told family that he committed suicide by hanging, a claim the family disputes.
Name: Roman Mwacheda

Description:
A police officer told Missing Voices in confidence that the deceased was shot dead by a police officer on September 15 during an arrest. An officer shot Mbugua thrice under unclear circumstances.
The death got condemnation from senior police officers in Kayole and it was agreed that a digital OB will only be circulated to gazetted officers unlike in other cases where even junior officers circulate such signals in their social media which end up in civilian social media handles.
 Nairobi police boss James Mugera refused to comment on the incident. He did not pick our calls and did not reply to our  text message seeking clarification on the killing.
Name: Kevin Mbugua

Description: According to police signal, police have confirmed Janet Chebet  was shot dead by her boyfriend, a senior police officer inspector Joseph Lourien Akorot Deputy OCS attached to Mau summit police station on September 5. He shot her in the back as she was going home after dropping her four year old son at school.
Name: Janet Chebet

Description: He was arrested after  his estranged wife allegedly stormed his house and intended to attack his new wife, family said. Neighbours stopped her. Shortly thereafter, police arrested him. When family enquired, they were told he was gone, then said he committed suicide in Juja cells.
Name: Dennis Mochoge

Description:
The Directorate of Criminal Investigations has confirmed a police officer shot and killed a young man on the spot for allegedly attempting to rob a police officer on August 27 at night.

The deceased was riding on a motorcycle when together with his accomplice who escaped attacked the officer on his way from a mosque.

Police allegedly recovered a pistol from the deceased,a Jericho pistol serial No: KP 44338853 with six live rounds of 9mm caliber
Name: Unknown

Description:
WITNESSES told Missing Voices that the young man was shot dead in broad day light at around mid day on August 28,2022 by a police officer from Dandora Police Station.

The young man is said to be a reformed street urchin who has been living in Dandora doing menial tasks for a living. Another youth was kidnapped by the police from the scene of the incident.

Nairobi County police chief James Mugera did not comment on the shooting. He did not respond to a text message sent to him by Missing Voices seeking his comments. 

A witness said the boy's body was taken to the City Mortuary. The incident was documented by Dandora Justice Centre
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police have confirmed shooting dead 
Paul Muriithi Naomi alias Muruthi on August 17 in Nairobi county Ruai.

He was shot inside his house allegedly for being a leader of a criminal gang.

Police said they have been looking for him for months. 

He allegedly attacked detectives from his house and did not surrender prompting police to kill him. 

Police say a pistol serial number B 681256 loaded with four rounds of 9mm calibre was recovered from deceased.
The pistol was robbed a week ago from a civilian.

His body was taken to City Mortuary in Nairobi.
Name: Paul Muriithi Naomi alias Muruthi

Description:
Police have confirmed shooting dead four armed youths in Turkana county, Turkana South subcounty,Lokwar village on August 1 2022.

Police said the deceased were armed and were riding on a motorcycle at the time.
Their three accomplices who were also armed escaped into a thicket. 

They recovered an AK-47 rifle with bolt number 03687 loaded with seven rounds of 7.62*39 mm  and a red Honda motorcycle Reg. No. KMEN 596A.

Bodies taken to Lodwar referral hospital mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Kiambu county police commander Perminus Muchangi confirmed police killed two men in
Kikuyu subcounty,Thogoto on July 26 at night.
He said the duo were wanted robbery with violence suspects. Missing Voices could not
independently confirm the claims.
Muchangi said an accomplice escaped with gunshot wounds.
Police said they recovered five home made guns from the deceased.
Muchangi said police also recovered one motorcycle which the three have been using to rob
residents of Kikuyu, Gitaru, Kinoo, King’eero, Thogoto, Uthiru and Gachie.
Name: Unknown

Manner of Death: First they were abducted in Nairobi on July 23 and their documents recovered in October 22 at the Aberdare ranges, Nyandarua county. Bones recovered from the scene to undergo tests for determination.
Description:
Zulfiqar Khan,Mohamed Zaid and taxi driver Nicodemus Mwania were first kidnapped by security agents attached to DCI on July 23.
Five individuals among them two civilians and three police officers attached to the DCI's disbanded SSU unit have been arrested in connection to the disappearances.
Their personal properties and documents were recovered on October 22 at Nyandarua county in the Aberdare forest. Bones recovered from the scene are undergoing tests for identification. Incase it is determined that the bones are for the deseased, we will have additional killings of three in October.
Name: Mohamed Zaid

Manner of Death: First they were abducted in Nairobi on July 23 and their documents recovered in October 22 at the Aberdare ranges, Nyandarua county. Bones recovered from the scene to undergo tests for determination.

Description:
Police officers from Kasarani Police Station killed two young men on July 22.
A police officer privy to the incident told MV in confidence the deceased were stealing clothes
from a shop next to Zimmerman police post on Friday night. The accessed the shop by break it’s
wall. The officer said one accomplice escaped.
Name: Unknown

Police officers from Kasarani Police Station killed two young men on July 22.
A police officer privy to the incident told MV in confidence the deceased were stealing clothes
from a shop next to Zimmerman police post on Friday night. The accessed the shop by break it’s
wall. The officer said one accomplice escaped.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Nairobi region police boss James Mugera confirmed police killed one person in a botched
robbery.
He said a pistol was found on him.
He said the man was in the company of three others and had been attacking and robbing
pedestrians in the morning of the fateful day when an alarm was raised, alerting undercover
officers on patrol.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police confirmed killing three people on July 19 in Nairobi county,along Mombasa road at Alpha
Centre.
Police claimed the deceased were armed with pistols and other offensive weapons and had
accosted and robbed one person of his personal property including phones and a laptop.
“As they were making away after the crime, they were confronted by police officers on duty.
Alarmed, they fired at the officers who engaged them promptly, fatally injuring three with two of
their accomplices escaping.” Said the police report. Police confirmed recovering a pistol from
the deceased.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Nairobi police commander James Mugera confirmed police killed two people in Nairobi county
at Mowlem on July 19 during a foiled robbery.
Mugera said one was killed on the spot while the second one who had escaped with gunshot
wounds was arrested by the public while bleeding and succumbed minutes later.
Police who attended the scene said they recovered a homemade gun that had four bullets, the
motorcycle they were using and a television set that had been stolen.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Nairobi police chief James Mugera confirmed police killing of one person in Githurai 44 and a
pistol recovered from him on July 18 at night.
The deceased is said to have been part of a gang that had been attacking and robbing residents
when police were alerted.
Three other accomplices managed to escape, police said.
Body taken to the city mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Police in Embu county,Embu West Sub-County have confirmed shooting dead two people who
police claimed were robbers.
They were allegedly robbing locals at gun point at night on July 14.
According to Embu West subcounty police chief Julius Musyoka,the deceased were a part of a
five man gang. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the claims.
Police pursued the five men and shot two dead on July 15 at Njúkiri village while three escaped
with gunshot wounds.
Name: Unknown

Description:
Nakuru county police commander Peter Mwanzo has confirmed police shot dead four people on
July 15 after they attacked police with “arrows and machetes.”
Mwanzo said the deceased were members of a criminal gang dubbed Nyuki Squad under another
crime umbrella dubbed Confirm,” The deceased were killed at Barut, Kwa Maiko village Nakuru
West sub-county.
Mwanzo said residents told police the gang was attacking people at night and police decided to
lay ambush.
Residents have however contradicted the police version. They say the four young men were
targeted by police and were actually picked from their houses before police shot them at one
place. Postmortem report indicates the four died after excessive bleeding caused by a hail of
Bullets.
Name: Collins Kipkorir

Description:
Police confirmed killing one man Tuesday evening in Nairobi county. The deceased is said
together with accomplices who managed to escape attacked a police officer in plainclothes at
Jamhuri cemetry.
Police had put an ambush following complaints from members of public that a gang of three had
been attacking and robbing pedestrians in the area when police were alerted and laid an ambush
while riding a bicycle. Kilimani police chief Muturi Mbogo confirmed the killing.
Name: Unknown

Description:
In Siaya county,Ungunja subcounty police boss Emmanuel Rono confirmed police shot dead
Aloice Owino Ooko on July 11 at around 4 PM.
Reason: The deceased allegedly blocked officers from Ungunja police station from arresting an
illicit brewer only identified as Nyamalo. Rono said Owino attacked police constable Douglas
Wangila using a panga and cut the officers hand.
In self protection,Rono said Wangila shot the deceased in the right side of the neck. According to
Rono,the junior officer had first shot twice in the air to scare the deceased without success.
Deceased was taken to Ambira subcounty hospital where he died and body kept in the same
facility.
Name: Aloice Owino Ooko

Description:
The police confirmed killing the deceased who was wanted for several robberies in Nairobi.
After more than three hours, police managed to gun down the suspect after he fell into an open
pit, where a latrine was about to be constructed at his rental house in Kamae,Kahawa West.
The police impounded a Ceska pistol loaded with two .9mm-calibre bullets, a used round and a
home-made gun at the suspect’s home. They also arrested the suspect’s friend, a 20-year-old
Woman.
Name: Ibrahim Waweru

Description: He was allegedly kidnapped together with a fiend, Jackson Kariuki by unknown men that were driving a Subaru at around 2 pm.
Name: Benson Kimani

Description: He was allegedly kidnapped together with a fiend, Benson Kimani by unknown men that were driving a Subaru at around 2 pm.
Name: Jackson Kariuki

Description: The police through their DCI official FB communication have confirmed Killing one young man in Nairobi City, at South B near Trans Towers building where police claim the deceased was among three men who had staged a robbery on June 28 at night. Police claim they responded to a distress call and ambushed the three who were riding on a motorcycle. Police allegedly ordered the trio to surrender but instead shot at the police car deflating one tire. This provoked the officers who shot back and killed one of the suspected men. His body was taken to City morgue. Police claim they recovered a browning pistol from the deceased loaded with three rounds of ammunition. They linked the weapon to earlier armed robberies in the city. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to confirm the circumstances of the death
Name: Unknown

Description: According to Nation newspaper, police confirmed killing a man on the night of August 8, in South B Nairobi County. He was killed in a shoot out after being trailed for some time in connection with a robbery in Industrial area. Police said they recovered a pistol from the deceased. N.B Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances that led to the man’s death.
Name: Unknown

Description: Police shot dead a herder, Apiti Lekartua, 17, on June 6,2022 while he was grazing livestock at Crest Ranch, Laikipia county. According to the media outlets, a police report from the Kariunga Police Post stated that six security officers were ambushed by bandits after impounding the cattle and they shot back at the attackers, firing a total of 34 bullets. The report stated that four police officers and two National Police Reservists were involved in the operation to flush out herders from a private farm. A community spokesman, Saituk Kaparo, claimed there were no armed bandits but only herders who were grazing livestock. No arrests have been made since the fatal shooting took place.
Name: Apiti Lekartua

Description: Police confirmed killing four people during a protest on June 2,2022 at Masimba,Kajiado county. The four were shot dead by GSU officers who were heading to Mombasa in a police truck and stopped to unblock a road after protesters block the road. The deceased were in a group of women protesting against the killing of a local teacher by an elephant. Missing Voices has confirmed the names of the four as Stanley Ntidu Tereu, Duncan Kabari Munke, Letomir Topoika and Dennis Matheka Mutua. No arrests had been made.
Name: Duncan Kabari Munke

Description: A source revealed that Lucy went missing together with her female friend on Sunday April 24,2022. They alleged the two ladies were bundled into a Subaru at Githurai 44 by plain clothes DCI officers. On April 26, Lucy’s body was discovered by herdsmen at Loitokitok  while her friend’s body was discovered at Mashuruu, about 140 KM apart.
Name: Lucy

Description:
Bullets fired at close range hit Shee Amadi Shee's head, damaged his brain and killed him, a postmortem report shows.
Shee, 21, lived in Likoni.
Likoni police shot him dead on Thursday noon, witnesses said. 
Police allege he wanted to attack them with a panga.
The autopsy, which MUHURI witnessed on Friday, showed three bullets struck Shee, two of which were removed. One is stuck.
Shee was riding a motorbike in Likoni with two others who were not hurt.Police allege they are members of a criminal gang. MUHURI does not condone criminal acts but demands that police must make arrests and not executions. They should investigate and bring to book criminal groups attacking Likoni locals. MUHURI asks the Independent Policing Oversight Authority (IPOA) to probe this shooting and act against culpable officers.
Name: Shee Amadi

Description: A Missing Voices source confirmed that a security official from DCI headquarters killed Samuel Mugo Muvota, 40 years of age, on May 16. He was allegedly traced by police and killed in Zimmerman.
Name: Samuel Mugo Muvota

Description: According to Missing Voices’ sources, Abednego John Munyau was shot dead in Mathare by a police officer allegedly attached to Pangani Police Station on May 6. Nairobi Police boss James Mugera told Missing Voices the shooting was as a result of a mistaken identity. Munyao was heading home from work during the 8 PM incident when he was shot 3 times at Amana Petrol Station. It was reported that the police shot him by mistake of another person, the police told them that they will take care of the postmortem.
Name: Abednego John Munyau

Description: Kasarani subcounty deputy police boss Purity Wahome has confirmed police from Kasarani shot dead one unknown youth on April 22,2022. She alleged the deceased and his pavilion passenger who escaped were on a motorcycle carrying a bicycle and a water pump when the police officers on patrol suspected them and flagged them. They refused to obey. Police shot in the air to warn them. “The pavilion passenger allegedly shot at the officers using a pistol as the deceased escaped on the motor cycle until he reached a dead end of the road.” Wahome told Missing Voices on phone. The deceased was the one riding the motor cycle. Wahome said he confronted the officers using a machete.” The officers shot in the air to scare and worn him but instead he advanced, that is when he was shot.” She said.
Name: Unknown

Description: DCI confirmed fatally shooting 2 people on April 6, 2022 in Nairobi County, Njiru Estate. Police alleged the duo and four others had stabbed a pedestrian and injured him seriously. N.B. Missing Voices could not confirm details of the incident.
Name: Unknown

Description: DCI confirmed fatally shooting 2 people on April 6, 2022 in Nairobi County, Njiru Estate. Police alleged the duo and four others had stabbed a pedestrian and injured him seriously. N.B. Missing Voices could not confirm details of the incident.
Name: Unknown

Description: On March 18, 2022 a video went viral showing officers from Pangani Police Station executing two individuals who were lying on the ground. The police report stated the deceased were suspected criminals who were fatally injured during a shoot-out with the officers. Contrastingly, the video shows no sign of a shoot-out; instead, Galgalo Bariso (a boda boda rider) and his passenger, Sharim Kimoa, are lying on the ground for a while before one of the officers shoots them. A post-mortem report revealed that Bariso was killed as a result of multiple gunshot wounds in the head, chest and abdomen. The officer shot Bariso 14 times. According to his mother, Galgalo 32, had gone to buy juice for his seven months expectant wife and never returned home.
Name: Sharim Kimoa

Description: Police have confirmed shooting and killing one man in Kiambu County,Thika town on March 17. They accused him of robbing two students at gun point who were in their way to buy a fruit at 9 pm. Police say the deceased was armed with a firearm with two rounds of ammunition and a machete. “Luckily, two cops on foot patrol heard the call of distress and rushed to the aid of the victims.” Said the DCI boss. DCI claims there was a shoot-out between the cops and the suspect. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the circumstances leading to the death
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: police officers from Kisauni police station.
Description: Kisauni police boss Juma Londo has confirmed police killed two people on suspicion of being members of a gang in Mombasa county. According to Londo, the duo were killed at dawn on March 15 in Junda Beach after defying an order by the police to stop. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances that lead to the death.
Name: Unknown

Description: Four men who identified themselves as police officers arrested two brothers in Lanet,Nakuru county on March 10. According to witnesses, the four stormed their home in Pemways Estate, Nakuru East sub-county. The police men ordered the two brothers to step out of the house, handcuffed them, closed the door and bundled them into a white car that was waiting outside the gate before they drove off. When the family tried to reach the brothers their phones went unanswered and were switched of later in the evening. Police say the matter is being investigated.
Name: Alfred Omboto

Location: Nairobi County, Roysambu subcounty,Kahawa West estate
Perpetrator: Police Officers on patrol from Kahawa West police station.
Description: Residents of Kahawa West who spoke to Missing Voices under condition of anonymity for fear of intimidation said police officers from Kahawa West police station shot dead three young men who were allegedly robbing pedestrians on March 9 at around 5AM. Missing Voices identified the trio as Alex Kariuki,a well-known football coach in Kahawa West, Peter and Martin. The trio are said to be from a neighbouring informal settlement known as Kamae.
Name: Alex Kariuki

Description: Rono Bunei has confirmed police constable Abel Chumba of Kaongo Kampio GSU camp in Meru county shot dead police constable Pontianas Ikumoli,22 on February 22 at 9 pm. Ikumoli was shot in the head. Chumba who escaped after the incident has sine been arrested and will be arraigned.
Name: Pontianas Ikumo

Description: The DCI has confirmed shooting and killing Jakande Kabende alias Kababa on February 22,2022 in Nairobi County, Mathare. DCI alleged the deceased was a member of a gang known as Katombi and was shot while he was robbing a middle aged woman at Mathare, Bondeni area. One Webley revolver with four rounds of ammunition was allegedly recovered from Kabende. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances that lead to the death
Name: Jakande Kabende alias Kababa

Description: According to media reports, Anthony Mwangi Njuguna a police officer at Migori police station shot dead his wife Maureen Moraa on February 20 before he committed suicide using the same weapon, his official AK 47 rifle. Police found 17 spent cartridges. Neighbours told police the two had quarrelled before they heard gunshots from the house. Njuguna had booked off duty at the report office at 11.30 pm Saturday, February 19 and proceeded to his house without handing over his rifle to the armoury as it is the practice after leaving work. The weapon was found next to his body with 13 bullets. He had spent 17 bullets whose cartridges were recovered therein. The bodies were moved to the mortuary as investigations into the incident go on. The young couple had been together for more than a year.
Name: Maureen Moraa

Description: The Director of Criminal Investigations George Kinoti has confirmed police on patrol Saturday February 19 shot and killed one person in Nairobi county, Kawangware. He said the deceased with others accosted a man and robbed him during the 9:30 PM incident. He said the victim’s screams of despair attracted the cops who were on patrol along Kabiru road. The deceased was allegedly part of a gang that was robbing pedestrians of their valuables that day. Kinoti said other gang members escaped with gunshot wounds.  A firearm loaded with 3 rounds of 9mm calibre was recovered from the deceased. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to confirm the circumstances that lead to the death.
Name: Unknown

Description: Witnesses have said a senior police officer attached to Coast Guard at Lake Naivasha shot and killed Simon Thuku on February 16 in Nakuru county, Naivasha subcounty,Karagita estate. A witness said the deceased was a licensed fisherman. Media quoted a witness as saying, “One of the fisheries officers had arrested us before the senior guy from Kenya Coast Guards Service came in and opened fire without any provocation,” said the witness. Thuku was shot in the back six times. Traders said that the perpetrator and the deceased had known each other and had been involved in a slight argument. Naivasha subcounty deputy commissioner who confirmed the incident said the matter is under investigation by Independent Police Oversight Authority and the Directorate of Criminal Investigations.
Name: Simon Thuku

Description: According to Shahidi News,an online news site, the deceased was shot dead on February 15 by police officers following a gun battle in Nairobi’s Korogocho slums. Police officers were allegedly notified of a crime and deployed to Korogocho where a shoot-out ensued. Police say that a firearm belonging to the deceased was recovered at the scene as well as four bullets, viagra tablets,bhang, ten sim cards and mobile phones.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: police officers on patrol from Nairobi Area.
Description: The Director of Criminal Investigations  confirmed police killed two people in Nairobi at Adams Arcade on February 9,2022. He said police on patrol were attracted by a parked motorcycle bearing an obscured registration plate, followed by a sudden tussle between two youthful men and members of the public. The deceased allegedly defied police orders to surrender and engaged police in a gun fight. The duo escaped on a motorcycle before police caught up with them and shot them dead. A pistol, three mobile phones and a Rolex wrist watch were recovered from the deceased. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances that lead to the death.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: police officers on patrol from Nairobi Area.

Description: The DCI confirmed shooting and killing one youth named Fadhili Mgaza in Mlango Kubwa, Nairobi on February 8,2022. They accused the deceased of being a member of a notorious criminal gang known as “Katombi” that has allegedly been stealing from residents. At the time, the police allege deceased was a pillion passenger and was allegedly terrorizing pedestrians at Mlango Kubwa when he came face to face with police officers on patrol. He allegedly shot at the police who fired back killing him on the spot as his accomplice managed to escape using the motorcycle. N.B. Missing Voices has been unable to verify the circumstances that lead to Mgaza’s death.
Name: Fadhili Mgaza

Description: Missing Voices confirmed that Patrick and four others were picked from their houses on February 7 on the accusation they were part of a gang. Their bodies were later found at City Mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: police officers from Mowlem police station
Description: According to Missing Voices sources, Dono Yayo a bodaboda rider was shot on January 29, 2022, around 9 am at his door while entering his house in Mowlem Tononoka area. The deceased’s wife heard the commotion and shooting. The officers were not known by name but they are allegedly from Mowlem police station. The OCS of the station said it was mistaken identity as they were tracing snatchers. He died on the spot and the body was taken to the City Mortuary. Reached for comment on phone by Missing Voices, acting Nairobi Police Commander James Mugera did not comment on the case of Muchuha and Yayo.
Name: Dono Yayo

Perpetrator: police officers from Ramula police post.
Description: Reagan Ndindi was allegedly shot dead by a police officer from Ramula police post in Siaya County at Gem Ramula village on January 24. He was a pillion passenger (on a bodaboda) at the time and was heading to work when he was shot by a bullet from the police. Police were dispersing students from Ramula Mixed Secondary School who were protesting the death of their teacher Calvince Okello. It was alleged by residents that Okello was killed by a police officer following a love triangle pitting Okello, his student and an officer. Police say Okello committed suicide. Siaya County police chief said investigations are underway as Ndindi's body was taken to Yala Sub-County Hospital Mortuary. IPOA is currently investigating the case.
Name: Reagan Ndindi

Perpetrator: police officers from Soweto police station.
Description: Duncan Okoko was allegedly arrested on January 22, 2022 by police officers from Soweto police station, Nairobi county, following a complaint of death threats against him by a woman she had lent money. Police beat him during the arrest. According to a post-mortem, Okoko died due to a brain trauma caused by a blunt object. Independent Police Oversight Authority are investigating five police officers in relation to the death.
Name: Duncan Okoko

Description: According to Daniel Kinuthia’s family and witnesses,he was called from his house by people suspected to be  police officers who were believed to be in a Toyota Probox on January 19 that was parked outside his place of residence. The car was spotted in Kiambu County, Murera village on the day he went missing. He is said to be friends with Charles Muchuha whose bodies were found dumped together along Kabarnet-Iten road in Elgeiyo-Marakwet county on January 25. An autopsy report by Dr Wangari Wambugu shows he died from strangulation. Had injuries in the kneck and head.
Name: Daniel Kinuthia

Description: According to Missing Voices sources, on January 18, 2022 around 1 pm, Charles Muchuha, a taxi driver was abducted by two men who identified themselves as police officers in Kiamaiko area at Jonsaga carwash. They bundled him in a private vehicle (Toyota Axio) KCV 526W silver in colour. The police officers took his phone and the keys during the arrest. When they couldn’t find him, the family reported the case at Huruma police station. Muchuha was later found dead  in Elgeiyo-Marakwet county. His body was dumped along Kabarnet-Iten road. An autopsy report by Dr Wangari Wambugu shows he died from strangulation. Had injuries in the kneck and head.
Name: Charles Muchuha

Perpetrator: police officers from Githurai 44 police station
Description: Police have confirmed killing one person in Nairobi county, Githurai 44 on January 18. A resident who sought anonymity said the deceased was only known as Ngatia. Police say the deceased was among five others who had attacked John Ndegwa using machetes. Five of the deceased's accomplices police say escaped with gunshot wounds. Body of deceased was taken to Nairobi City Mortuary.  Police allegedly recovered a home made gun from the deceased. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently verify the circumstances that lead to the death
Name: Ngatia

Description: Star newspaper reported 15 people suspected of being terrorists were killed by security agents in Lamu county,Lamu East subcounty,Bodhei area.

Perpetrator: police officers from Bondo police station.
Description: According to the Star newspaper, 26 year old Vitalis Okinda died at Bondo police station where police were holding him. Okinda went to check his motorcycle at the station which police had impounded at Bondo Subcounty hospital where he had parked it as he entered the facility to seek Covid-19 vaccination. The facility's security alerted the police when Okinda defied orders not to enter the facility on a motorcycle. It was impounded. At the station police accused him of assault, resisting arrest and being in possession of 21 rolls of bhang. Deceased's mother said police demanded a Ksh 40 000 bribe to free the son which she did not have and asked them to take him to court. The Star reported witnesses saying the Okinda’s body had visible physical injuries when he was picked up from the morgue attendant. Case reported to IPOA.
Name: Vitalis Okinda

Perpetrator: Kenya Police officer and a prison warder are attached to the office of the current Kericho County governor
Description: The night of January 3, 2022, it is reported that two bodyguards attached to a senior politician in Kericho arrested two males. They accused the duo of stealing beehives and tortured them before dropping them along the road near Brooke Estate. One of the victims, Leonard Kipyegon, died from his injuries, while the survivor sustained serious injuries. A police officer who spoke to Missing Voices under condition of anonymity for fear of intimidation confided that the said bodyguards a Kenya Police officer and a prison warder are attached to the office of the current Kericho County governor.
Name: Leonard Kipyegon

Perpetrator: police officers on patrol from Naivasha police station.
Description: Police in Nakuru county, Naivasha subcounty confirmed shooting dead unknown suspect on January 3, in the morning near Mirera area. According to Naivasha police boss, Samuel Waweru, the deceased and his accomplices who fled with gunshot wounds allegedly wanted to steal wheat from a stalled lorry when police shot at them during the 3am incident near Mirera area. N.B. Missing Voices couldn’t verify the incidents leading to the death.
Name: Unknown

Location: Nairobi county, Mukuru Kwa Njenga slum
Perpetrator: police officer from Mukuru police post  during protest against eviction.
Status of Case: Multi-agency investigations ongoing, including Internal Affairs Unit and IPOA.
Description: According to the Standard newspaper, Samuel Okoth Otieno was shot during a protest against eviction from a disputed land in Nairobi, Mukuru Kwa Njenga slum on December 27. The land tussle is pitting a private developer and current landlords who claim the former sold the land to them. The matter is in court despite the forceful evictions. Multi-agency investigations ongoing, including Internal Affairs Unit and IPOA.
Name: Samuel Okoth Otieno

Perpetrator: junior officer Corpral Joseph Muthunga from Kedong AP camp.
Description: According to The Star newspaper, Senior Sergeant Ayub Polo was shot dead on December 25, 2021 by his colleague, Corpral Joseph Muthunga in Nakuru county, Naivasha subcounty at Kedong Camp during a Christmas party. Polo was allegedly concerned that Muthunga was drinking alcohol yet he was on duty. It is reported, Muthunga responded by killing his boss on the spot using his official G-3 rifle. Muthunga has since been arraigned.
Name: Senior sergeant Ayub Polo

Description: Police confirmed through the DCI Facebook account that they shot dead two men they claim were allegedly planning to commit robbery at a supermarket in Ruaka, Kiambu county on December 14,2021. Police claim they learnt of the plan through their number where callers anonymously alert police. Police allege the deceased were armed with a cseka pistol loaded with 5 rounds of 9mm caliber and opened fire aimed at detectives after they declined an order to surrender. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police reports that lead to the death of the two males.
Name: Unknown

Description: Police report constable Benson Imbatu from Kabetee Police Station got into a domestic dispute with his wife, Carol, on the morning of December 12, 2021. This allegedly resulted in Benson fatally shooting his wife. Neighbours and Boda boda riders around the area rushed to the house and Benson went on a killing spree. He killed 6 people - including his wife - and injured two. Benson proceeded to commit suicide. Officials state Benson Imbatu was living with a mental disability. Locals protested demanding answers from the State - mostly pertaining to why the officer was at work if he was suffering from a mental health disability.
Name: Paul Githinji

Perpetrator: Detectives attached to Kericho Police Station
Description: According to a story published by Kenyans.co.ke, police in Kericho County through the county criminal investigations officer John Onyango confirmed shooting and killing 3 people on December 11,2021. The police had laid ambush at Kapsurer trading center after suspecting the five were part of a gang that staged robberies in Kericho. Onyango said the occupants of the suspected car defied orders to stop. That is when police chased them and sprayed their car with bullets killing the trio. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the police reports of the circumstances leading to the deaths of the 3 young men.
Name: Unknown

Description: Police have confirmed killing a youth in Nairobi, Mathare on December 7 evening allegedly for being a member of what police say is an outlawed gang. They claim the gang has been wrecking havoc in Starehe subcounty. "Together with four of his accomplices, Ngaruiya had attacked a pedestrian at gunpoint and taken away his mobile phone and other valuables." The DCI report seen by Missing Voices reads. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police claims.
Name: Ngaruiya

Description: Area police boss Henry Wesonga was quoted by The Star newspaper as saying a group of 5 attacked police officers on patrol using crude weapons thinking they were students from Maseno University. Police officers killed two of the members in the group, while the other 3 allegedly escaped. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to independently verify the circumstances leading to the death of the two males.
Name: Unknown

Description: Area police boss Henry Wesonga was quoted by The Star newspaper as saying a group of 5 attacked police officers on patrol using crude weapons thinking they were students from Maseno University. Police officers killed two of the members in the group, while the other 3 allegedly escaped. N.B. Description: Tuko reported that three police officers, Hussein Ali, Elvis Kioko, and Glaide Gwaga, from Ruai police station were on patrol on December 2 at night when they received a distress call about a stolen motorbike. They attempted to track the motorbike to Chokaa area, where two bodaboda riders appeared. Police reports state the riders sped off when police flagged them which allegedly prompted Ali and Kioko to fire three shots and fatally injuring 29-year old Dennis Wanyoike - one of the passengers on the bodaboda. The three officers are currently in custody.
Name: Dennis Wanyoike

Description: According to Opera News, police in Kisumu shot dead Walter Odhiambo in the morning of November 25, 2021 in Kisumu County, Kondele trading centre. Police reports state the deceased threatened the public using a machete. They allege when asked to surrender, Odhiambo confronted the police officers with his machete and that is when they shot him and killed him. Missing Voices sources state otherwise, they report that Walter Odhiambo was killed in cold blood by the police despite having surrendered and accepted arrest.
Name: Walter Odiambo aka Jusa

Description: According to Shahidi News, the deceased suspected was shot dead on November 23,021 allegedly during a botched robbery in Mwiki, Nairobi County. Police say the deceased was in a group of four and had been robbing pedestrians in the area when an alarm was raised. Police fatally shot one of the men, whose identity remains unknown. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the circumstances that lead to the death of the unknown male.
Name: Unknown

Description: According to the Nation. Africa, Saddam Hassan Ali was abducted on November 19, 2021 at night by armed men who disguised their faces. Ali was bundled into a pickup with sped off towards Nairobi. His father Hassan Ali, said his son is the source of livelihood for his four children, two wives, three siblings, his father and his mother. Ali’s whereabouts still remain unknown.
Name: Sadam Hassan Ali

Description: 37 year old Zena Ali Wanjiku was in company of 2 others when they were blocked by a black Subaru at Allsops at 8:30 PM, Thursday 18th November 2021. Armed men then got out of the Subaru and asked their names before forcing them into the Subaru vehicle and speedily drove away. The 2 others who were with Zena Wanjiku have since been freed. Wanjiku’s whereabouts still remain unknown as family members claim they have searched for Wanjiku in police stations and morgues without trace.
Name: Zena Ali Wanjiku

Description: Police have confirmed killing one man in Isiolo County inside Wazee Hukumbuka bar on November 16,2021. Police reports state that officers were responding to a distress call from a bar owner when they ordered a group to surrender. The group allegedly defied orders and tried to shoot the officers, so the police fatally shot one of them. The deceased’s body was taken to Nanyuki morgue for identification.
Name: Unknown

Description: According to Nation Africa, Susan Wanjiku and ten others were arrested on November 15 at around 7.30 PM at Jamia Mosque, by police officers from Nairobi’s Central police station. Witnesses said police tortured them outside the station’s canteen after ordering them to remove clothes and remained naked. They were later freed the same day without any charges preferred against them. Witnesses say Wanjiku developed complications after the release and claim she succumbed to police brutality. Her body was taken to City Mortuary by police as booked as unknown.
Name: Susan Wanjiku

Description: According to Citizen TV, the death of 29-year-old James Nungu Nziva alledgely occurred after a stray bullet from a police officer attached to Pangani police station hit him on November 9, 2021. It was reported that police were pursuing a mobile phone snatcher when the accident occurred along Juja Road in Nairobi County, Mlango Kubwa. The deceased’s wife said he had just called him to pick their child from school only to be told her husband has been shot dead. The Independent Policing and Oversight Authority (IPOA) has commenced investigations into the killing.
Name: James Nugu Nziva

Description: According to Nation, on October 31, 2021, police from Ruiru Police Station fatally shot a man allegedly suspected to be engaging in crime. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the death.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officer - Githurai Mwiki Police Station
Description: On October 29, 2021, police in Githurai 45, Kiambu County police officers confirmed the killing of three people. The police report indicated the deceased were killed over suspicion of stealing a motor vehicle from Kayole estate on October 29. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to independently verify the circumstances of the deaths.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officer - Githurai Mwiki Police Station

Description: The Standard newspaper reported that the victim, professor Hassan Nandwa disappeared at the Anti Terror Police Unit offices shortly after he visited a man who had finished his jail term, on October 29. There was immense public pressure on the State from Muslim leaders, the civil society and the general public to find Nandwa. Nandwa was found alive in Mwingi town, on November 7.
Name: Professor Hassan Nandwa

Perpetrator: Police Officers from Kairobangi Police Station
Description: According to Radio Jambo 9 AM news on October 21, an unidentified male was shot dead by police officers during an alleged botched robbery in Korogocho on October 20.N.B. Missing Voices was unable to confirm the incidents that lead to the killing of the youth
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: On Mashujaa Day, October 20th, youths in White Castle Are, Mathare had a political demonstration. Miano got caught in the protest when he was shot, twice, by stray bullets and died. Miano was a father of two and the breadwinner of his family.
Name: Miano

Perpetrator: police officers from Pap Onditi Police Station
Description: According to sources, police officers based at Pap Onditi Police Station arrested Benson Jacob Ouma on June 19, 2021 at Sondu Market for not wearing a mask properly. Witnesses allege that he was severely brutalised before being bundled into a waiting police vehicle and taken for overnight detention at Pap Onditi Police Station. Witnesses allege that he was severely brutalised before being bundled into a police vehicle and taken for overnight detention at Pap Onditi Police Station. The following morning, his wife recieved a call from the Police asking her to come and take her husband to hospital. She took him to Sigowet Hospital and were referred to Kericho District Hospital. Check-ups revealed that he had broken his spinal cord and had to be admitted. He stayed in hospital for 2 months as he couldn't support himself or even eat solid food. He was referred to Eldoret Refferal Hospital for corrective surgery but before the family could raise the requested medical fee, he painfully succumbed to his injuries on October 9, 2021.
Name: Benson Jacob Ouma

Description: On October 19, 2021, witnesses claim Adolft Miano Wanjiru was arrested by plain-clothed officers from Pangani Police Station and bundled into a private Toyota Probox. Miano’s body was discovered by family members the following day at City Mortuary.
Name: Adolf Miano Wanjiru

Perpetrator: Police officer from Kamweline police post
Description: The Inspector General of police Hillary Mutyambai has confirmed a police officer from Igembe North subcounty,Meru county shot dead Patrick Koome,a Bodaboda rider on October 18. It is alleged the officer killed Koome at Muthutati Market for refusing to give him a ride. The Inspector General of the Police Mr Hilary Mutyambai ordered Internal Affairs Unit to investigate the killing. He said the unit's findings will determine action to be taken. As of October 25,the cop was being held by police for two weeks to facilitate investigations.
Name: Patrick Koome

Perpetrator: Police officer - Undercover police officers Kasarani Police Station
Description: Kasarani Police Station confirmed officers shot dead three men on October 14 around 1 AM. The deceased were shot dead outside Roysambu Primary School in Zimmerman by undercover police officers from Kasarani police station. Kasarani Police Station alleges the deceased were robbing pedestrians at gun point. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the incidents leading up to the killing.
Name: Unknown

Description: On October 14, 2021, at around 8:30PM, Mohammed Abubakar was abducted at gun point on as he walked home from the mosque in Majengo, Mombasa. According to witnesses, Abubakar was arrested and bundled into one of three cars that were waiting, including a white Toyota Probox, before being driven off at speed. It is claimed, the National Transport Safety Authority was unable to locate the owner of the vehicle used to arrest Abubakar. To date, Abubakar’s family has not located his whereabouts. His loved ones describe him as a musician and youth motivator.
Name: Mohammed Abubakar

Perpetrator: Police officer - Undercover police officers Kasarani Police Station
Description: Kasarani Police Station confirmed officers shot dead three men on October 14 around 1 AM. Kasarani Police Station alleges the deceased were robbing pedestrians at gun point. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the incidents leading up to the killing.

Description: Police have confirmed killing a man in Samburu County, Samburu West subcounty, Longewan village on October 13. Reports indicate police officers attached to Anti- Stock Theft unit in Samburu County were pursuing the deceased. The police allege the deceased died during an exchange of fire between bandits and security personnel.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police Officer - Misikhu police station (Simon Said
Description: Police officers from Misikhu police station in Bungoma county, Webuye have confirmed shooting dead a 45-year-old man, Simiyu Soita, on October 7 during an anti-illicit brew operation. A police report claims the deceased attacked a police constable who they claim initially fired twice in the air to scare the deceased before fatally shooting him. Soita later succumbed to his gunshot wounds at Lugulu Mission Hospital.
Name: Simiyu Soita

Perpetrator: Police officer - Undercover police officers Kasarani Police Station
Description: Police in Kasarani shot dead a man said to be a tout in Nairobi County, Roysambu subcounty, Githurai 44 estate on October 6. The deceased is said to be targeted after he was suspected of snatching phones from passengers and pedestrians. His body was taken to City Mortuary.
Name: Unknown

Description: Around 4PM, Clement Ndirangu, a boda boda rider, was riding along Thika Road with a friend when they encountered police officers. The police shot him on his leg and hip and his friend managed to get away unhurt.  Zero was brought to a chemist where the bullet from his leg was removed, but not the one from his hip. Afterwards, he arrived at a Hospital where the doctor said he wasn't in danger. Ndirangu went home and the following day was found dead.
Name: Clement Ndirangu

Perpetrator: Police Officers - Serem Police Station (Joseph Otido)
Description: On October 4, 2021, On October 4, 2021, Police in Hamisi, Vihiga confirmed killing a 26-year-old man, named Edwin Ndege a fresh graduate from Kitui Teaches Training college, who they allege escaped from unlawful custody, which aboard a police car heading to court. Police reports claim Ndege slipped out of his handcuffs and ran towards Hamisi forest when a police constable fatally shot him. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police version of events.
Name: Edwin Ndege

Description: Police in Nairobi confirmed killing an unknown man in Dandora, Nairobi on October 4, 2021 around dawn. Police allege they were responding to an alert that claimed 3 youths attacked a woman on her way home. When police arrived, they allege the deceased shot at them forcing them to respond with gun-fire, killing the man. There were no reports of any injured officer. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm police claims.
Name: Unknown

Status of Case: Kiminini sub-county police commander Francis Tumo said the matter is under investigation.
Description: According to the Standard, on September 28 2021, Robinson Manyonge was with a friend outside at night when they were allegedly stopped by three police officers who were on patrol at Big Tree area. It was reported the officers clobbered them accusing them of breaking curfew rules. Manyonge's friend managed to escape and was shocked to learn of Manyonge’s death the following morning. According to sources, Manyonge had been arrested earlier in the month with burglary, close relatives allege it was a false accusation. The second hearing for this case was supposed to occur on October 5, 2021. Some allege that the police officers could have had a grudge against Manyonge as a result of the ongoing case. Kiminini sub-county police commander Francis Tumo said the matter is under investigation.
Name: Robinson Manyonge

Description: On September 25, 2021, Rabin Patel Ogeto, a 30 year old boda-boda rider, was riding his motorcycle in downtown Nairobi when he was allegedly flagged down by a police officer for riding on the wrong side of Kirinyaga Road. According the United Bodaboda Association, the officer demanded a bribe and when Ogeto said he did not have any money an altercation started. This is when the officer shot him dead. The officer – allegedly known as Elija Mutunga - was attacked by an angry mob, rushed to Nairobi Hospital under critical condition. Central Policy Deputy OCPD, denies these claims and reported that 26-year-old Elijah Mutunga was attacked by a mob of bodaboda riders. The officers were forced to shoot in the air to disperse the mob. IPOA and IAU launched investigations into the case
Name: Rabin Patel Ogeto

Perpetrator: Nairobi's Operations Branch & Crime Research and Intelligence Burial
Description: The Police through the DCI Facebook account have confirmed shooting dead two young men in Nairobi on September 18 at 11 pm at Embakasi East constituency, Mukuru Kwa Njenga. The deceased were shot dead by police officers drawn from different specialized detachments led by Nairobi's Operations Branch & Crime Research and Intelligence Burial. Police claim they recovered an Austrian made glock pistol and 29 live rounds of 9 mm calibre, from one of the deceased. The Police through the DCI Facebook account have confirmed shooting dead two young men in Nairobi on September 18 at 11 pm at Embakasi East constituency, Mukuru Kwa Njenga. The deceased were shot dead by police officers drawn from different specialized detachments led by Nairobi's Operations Branch & Crime Research and Intelligence Burial. The deceased were shot dead by police officers drawn from different specialized detachments led by Nairobi's Operations Branch & Crime Research and Intelligence Burial. Police claim they recovered an Austrian made glock pistol and 29 live rounds of 9 mm calibre, from one of the deceased. The Police through the DCI Facebook account have confirmed shooting dead two young men in Nairobi on September 18 at 11 pm at Embakasi East constituency, Mukuru Kwa Njenga. Perpetrator: Officers from Buruburu and Kariobangi police stations
Description: Police confirmed killing two unknown men in Nairobi County at two separate locations in Buruburu and Kariobangi on September 15. Police said the man in Buruburu was wanted for a series of robberies in the area and he was using a green motorbike. In Kariobangi, the police allege the victim was engaging in crime when the residents called the police. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police version of the incident.
Name: Unknown

Description: Police confirmed killing Haila Asanake,17, by a stray bullet fired by a police officer in Nairobi county, Kiamaiko area,Huruma Eastate on September 9 around 5:30 pm. The police officer was allegedly from Pangani police station. Asanake was allegedly standing at the balcony of their house when police officers fired allegedly to disperse a crowd. According to an autopsy report by Dr. Peter Maturi Mwamba, Asanake died as a result of Hemorrhagic shock due to a single low velocity gunshot to the chest.
Name: Haila Asanake

Description: On August 7, 2021, Ayale Asanaq, a 22 year old male, was allegedly shot by police officers. The residents were requesting to know why the officers were patrolling Kiamaiko, which is out of their jurisdiction, and harassing the community. The officers shot into the air and a stray bullet hit Ayale. Ayal was taken to Jumuiya Hospital and pronounced dead on arrival.
Name: Ayale Asanaq

Description: North Eastern regional police boss Rono Bunei confirmed police shot dead unknown man on September 2 in Mandera County, Katullo subcounty. He said five rifles were recovered from the deceased. Rono said police came across four gunmen who were riding on a motorcycle and shot one of them while three escaped. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to independently verify police claims
Name: Unknown

Description: Police in Kisumu East Subcounty confirmed shooting dead to youths on August 28 morning. Police claim the youths were part of a 15 member gang that has allegedly been terrorizing residents of Ogango, Migosi and Lolwe estates for weeks, brutally assaulting them in their homes before getting away with key household items among other valuables. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police claims against the deceased.
Name: unknown

Police claim the youths were part of a 15 member gang that has allegedly been terrorizing residents of Ogango, Migosi and Lolwe estates for weeks, brutally assaulting them in their homes before getting away with key household items among other valuables. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police claims against the deceased.
