Location: Nairobi county Roysambu subcounty,Kahawa West estate.
Description: K 24 TV reported one tuk-tuk driver was allegedly shot dead by police in Kahawa West protests during a demonstrating by residents over demolitions of kiosks. According to the TV residents say Nairobi Metropolitan Services (NMS) police started destroying their business kiosks at around 3 am in the morning prompting them to react. They say there was no prior notice ahead of the demolitions. MV went to the ground and confirmed that Alex Macharia was allegedly shot dead by police from Kahawa West police station. He was a Tuktuk rider. Macharia was not one of the protestors. Witnesses told MV he was shot by a stray bullet and died on the spot. IPOA released a statement saying it is investigating the case.
Name: Alex Macharia

Perpetrator: Police officers on patrol from Dadajabula Police Post.
Description: A police report confirms the killing of Yerror Noor and an unidentified male on August 24, 2021. The police claim the deceased were allegedly engaging in crime, police officers demanded them to surrender and a shoot-out ensued. Yerror and the unknown male were fatally shot. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances of the death.
Name: Yerrow Noor

Perpetrator: Police officers on patrol from Dadajabula Police Post.
Description: A police report confirms the killing of Yerror Noor and an unidentified male on August 24, 2021. The police claim the deceased were allegedly engaging in crime, police officers demanded them to surrender and a shoot-out ensued. Yerror and the unknown male were fatally shot. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances of the death.
Name: unknown

Description: On August 24, 2021, Catherine Njoki, a 27 year old mother of two, was allegedly arrested by police officers from DCI Pangani. The next morning she was found dead in City Mortuary in the company of another male victim whose identity is unknown. The police reports states they were found stealing in Muthiaga and fired at police officers. Catherine had 8 bullets.
Name: Catherine Njoki

Description: It was reported that Police Constable Bernard Sivo shot dead his 29 year old girlfriend, Mary Nyambura, while she was receiving treatment at Njoro subcounty hospital on August 23 at midnight in Nakuru county, Njoro subcounty. Sivo had allegedly assaulted the deceased which prompted her to seek treatment before he followed her to hospital armed with his AK 47 riffle where he fired 10 bullets killing her on the spot. He later allegedly committed suicide using the same gun at Njoro police station.
Name: Mary Nyambura

Location: Kajiado County, Kajiado North subcounty,Ngong Suswa road.
Perpetrator: Emma Sopiata attached to Gilgil Weighbridge police station
Description: A police officer manning a mobile weighbridge along Ngong-Suswa road accidentally shot dead her colleague during a scuffle with a motorist who had refused to heed their order to stop. According to a police report filed at Ngong Police Station, a team of security and weighbridge officers gave the lorry driver a chase using a Toyota Hilux Double Cabin car when he defied their directive. Upon reaching Kimuka trading centre, the driver stopped and began reversing his lorry to hit their vehicle resulting in a scuffle that saw Police Constable Emma Sopiato shoot her colleague Fanuel Abongo. “The driver of the said lorry on being flanked to stop he defied the order and instead reversed to hit the occupants, that during the commotion, Emma who was seated at the back right of the driver discharged her riffle an AK 47 S/NO 4915784. which hit NO.95790 CPL Fanuel Abongo a colleague on the right side of ribs and exited through the left side of ribs,” The police OB report reads.
Name: Fanuel Abongo

Description: According to witnesses’ accounts, police officers on patrol from Kayole attacked John Kiiru who was a pillion passenger heading home on August 19 past midnight. The bodaboda rider managed to escape. It is alleged Kiiru made a phone call at 12:30AM and confirmed he had been assaulted by the police. He collapsed at Tushauriane stage where he was found dead the following day. His death sparked protests from locals. The autopsy done at Mama Lucy Hospital shows John Kiiru's head was bludgeoned with blunt objects, causing internal bleeding into the brain.Nairobi regional police boss Augustine Nthumbi said the matter would be investigated while IPOA has requested witnesses to volunteer information.
Name: John Kiiru

Description: A report by Muslims for Human Rights published on August 18 alleges Abdulhakim Salim Sagara was abducted by security agents in Mombasa County at Mlango wa papa as he was coming from prayers at a Mosque.The security agents were driving in a car registration number KBQ 035C. Sagara was coming from a mosque after prayers.Sagara and two others got arrested in 2018 on terror-related charges, his lawyer, Mbugua Mureithi, told MUHURI.Shanzu Law Courts released them on bond. One of the conditions was to report at ATPU offices in Mombasa monthly,his lawyer Mbugua told Muhuri. Sagara did this religiously. A video shared by Muhuri showed security agents bundling Sagara in their car. To date, Sagara’s whereabouts remain unknown.
Name: Abulhakim Sagara

Location: Laikipia County, at Doldol police station line.
Description: The Standard newspaper reported that a police officer shot the deceased in Laikipia County, Doldol police station after an argument between them. He killed him using an AK-47 riffle. It happened on Tuesday August 17. Laikipia County Commissioner Daniel Nyamete told Missing Voices that the perpetrator is still at large with his official loaded AK 47.
Name: Leonard Ojwang

Perpetrator: Police Officers from Dandora Police Station
Description: Police confirmed killing Fidel in Nairobi County,Dandora Estate on August 16 2021 at Joy Villa in Dandora, allegedly after staging a robbery along Mwas road. Police claim the man was a suspected criminal. An allegation that Missing Voices could not ascertain from independent sources. A firearm and two rounds of 9mm caliber, were allegedly recovered from the man. Two of his accomplices escaped with bullet shots. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the incident.
Name: Fidel

Location: Nairobi County, Roysambu subcounty, Githurai estate.
Perpetrator: undercover police officers from Kasarani police station.
Description: Police confirmed killing a man in Nairobi County, Roysambu subcounty, Githurai 44 at Githurai bridge on August 15 at 9.30 pm. Police alleged the deceased was armed with a pistol and was with other five accomplices who escaped. Police claim they were allegedly robbing pedestrians along Githurai bridge. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the incident.
Name: unknown

Description: According to sources, Ian and his friends were out for lunch in Mathare when police officers attempted to arrest them after confirming their names. Ian resisted and attempted to ask the reasons for arrest. One of the police officer allegedly pulled out his gun and shot Ian. Everyone in the hotel, including the two friends, ran away.
Name: Ian Mutiso

Description: The deceased a suspected juvenile gang member was shot and killed by police officer in Likoni area. It was reported that over 40 gang members attacked and injured community members.
Name: unknown

Description: According to sources, on August 9, 2021, two young men of ages between 18-20 were shot dead at Amana Petrol Station in Mathare.
Name: unknown

Perpetrator: Police officer from Moi Air Base
Description: On August 9, 2021, Mutiso was having lunch when allegedly a police officer from Moi Air Base Police post arrived and ordered everyone to get out of the Hotel with the exception of Mutiso.Witnesses state Mutiso confirmed his identity and was then shot 5 times. It was reported that Mutisho was a wanted person by police officers.
Name: Mutiso

Description: According to sources, on August 9, 2021, two young men of ages between 18-20 were shot dead at Amana Petrol Station in Mathare.
Name: unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Mandera Police Station
Description: According to the Star Newspaper, police confirmed a multi-agency security team on patrol killed unknown man on suspicion of terrorism on August 6 in Mandera County,Kutulo subcounty. Police said the deceased was riding on a motorcycle with his accomplice who managed to escape.Police alleged the duo failed to stop when they were flagged down and a shootout ensued. Police said they were tip off by members of the public of an impending attack by the duo. Police claim 432 bullets, two Mark 4 and two AK47 rifles were allegedly recovered from the deceased. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the incident.
Name: Unknown

Description: It was reported that Nyamai snatched a phone from a lady. A police officer asked him to surrender, arrested, made him kneel down and fatally shot him in the chest.
Name: Nyamai

Location: Embu County, Manyatta subcounty, Kenga village.
Perpetrator: Police officers from Manyatta Police Station
Description: Police confirmed killing a protestor in Embu County, Manyatta subcounty, Kianjokoma town on August 5.The Daily Nation reported that the unidentified man was shot dead in the head by a police officer and died on the spot. Missing Voices independently confirmed the victim is identified as Moses Kimanthi, aged 30. The shooting occurred during a protest against the killing of two brothers, Emmanuel Mutura and Benson Njiru who allegedly died under police custody at Manyatta Police Station after their arrest on August 1. The family of the deceased told Missing Voices that no investigations have been launched to get justice.
Name: Moses Kimanthi

Perpetrator: Police officers from Pangani Police station
Description: Police confirmed shooting and killing a youth at night on August 4,2021 in Mathare, Nairobi. The police report alleges officers from Pangani police station responded to a distress call. Police said the suspects had robbed a female pedestrian of her shopping and cash near Kiboro bridge in the slum. The deceased allegedly opened fire when officers asked the suspects to surrender. Police fatally shot him. The report claims two accomplices managed to escape. Police allegedly recovered two machetes and a loaded pistol. N.B. Missing Voices could not independently confirm the police allegations from independent sources.
Name: unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Pangani Police station
Description: According to reports, teenager Kelvin Nyamai was allegedly arrested by police officers from Pangani police station before they later shot him dead on August 4 at around 7 pm and took the body to City Mortuary. It is not clear why police killed him.
Name: Kelvin Nyamai

Location: Homa Bay, Ndhiwa Subcounty, Ndhiwa Police Station.
Perpetrator: Police officers from Ndhiwa Police Station
Occupation: Tractor driver at Sukari Industries Limited
Description: According to Nation Newspaper, police from Ndhiwa Police Station confirmed arresting Dan Buoge on July 31 at Sukari Industries Limited after the management called the police. Police confirmed that Buoge committed suicide in a police cell at Ndhiwa Police Station using his overall. However, witnesses state Buoge was brutalized before being taking to the police station. IPOA has launched investigations into the case.
Name: Dan Buoge

Perpetrator: Police officers from Kilimani Police Station
Description: Police through the official DCI Facebook account confirmed shooting dead two unknown armed men on August 1 in Nairobi County, Kilimani. Police claim they received a distress call from a taxi driver and his client after the suspects carjacked the duo, took their phones and sped off in the vehicle. Police blocked the car and ordered the suspects to surrender but defied and opened fire. The police shot dead the duo and allegedly recovered three guns from the deceased and six unspent bullets. N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the incident.
Name: unknown

Perpetrator: Corporal Consolota Njeri, Corporal Benson Mbuthia, Constables Lilian Cherono, Martin Wanyama, Nicholas Sang and Constable James Mwaniki, who was driving the police vehicle that fateful night
Description: According to Nation newspaper, Benson Njiru,22 and his brother Emmanuel Mutura,19 were arrested on August 1 past 10PM at Kianjokoma Town in Embu County by police officers from Manyatta Police Station who were enforcing the 10PM-4 AM curfew. Their bodies were later discovered at Embu Level Five Hospital Morgue. Their parents insist police murdered their sons. Local police chief in charge of Embu East, Emily Ngaruiya said the duo were injured after they jumped off a moving police car and were pronounced dead on arrival at Embu Level Five hospital. According to THE STAR which quoted pathologists report, the brothers died as a result of being hit with a hard blunt object in the head. Benson Njiru’s body had multiple injuries on the head and broken limbs while Emmanuel Mutura had head injuries. The officers allegedly involved in the killings of Benson and Emmanuel are Corporal Consolota Njeri, Corporal Benson Mbuthia, Constables Lilian Cherono, Martin Wanyama, Nicholas Sang and Constable James Mwaniki, who was driving the police vehicle that fateful night. They have all been arraigned after IPOA investigations.
Name: Benson Njiru

Perpetrator: Police officers from Kilimani Police Station

N.B. Missing Voices was unable to verify the circumstances of the incident.

Location: Tharaka Nithi County, Maara subcounty,Majira village
Perpetrator: police officer attached to Majira Police Post in Tharaka Nithi County
Description: According to reports,a police officer attached to Majira Police Post in Tharaka Nithi County, Maara subcounty, Majira village shot dead Brian Munene on July 31,2021. Brian Munene from Majira village had been working at the police post, serving a non-custodial sentence.It remains unclear as to why the officer killed Munene.
Name: Brian Munene

Description: According to reports, Inspector  Ibrahim Bonaya- in charge of crime branch at Masii police station and civilian Noor Posta were killed on July 30,2021 in Machakos county, Kathome area. Machakos County Commissioner John Ondego confirmed the vehicle was sprayed with 18 bullets. It is alleged by eye witness accounts that the perpetrators were from police elite squad, the Special Crimes Unit.
Name: Ibrahim Bonaya-

Description: According to reports, two people including a police officer and his passenger were killed on July 30,2021 in Machakos county, Kathome area. Machakos County Commissioner John Ondego confirmed the vehicle was sprayed with 18 bullets. It is alleged by eye witness accounts that the perpetrators were from police elite squad, the Special Crimes Unit.
Name: Noor Posta .

Location: Meru County, Tigana West subcounty,Kimachia-Chung’ari village.
Perpetrator: AP Police Officer attached to home of Meru County Governer
Description: According to reports, a police officer attached to the home of Meru Deputy governor, Titus Ntuchiu shot dead Morris Mutuma on July 30,2021. This is after workers in the politician’s farm raised a distress call. The deceased allegedly threatened to slash the police officer before he was shot death. The police officer who killed Morris was arraigned and taking to court.
Name: Morris Mutuma alias Kimba

Location: Kisumu County, Kisumu East Subcounty, Nyamasaria village
Description: Police confirmed shooting dead two males, Allan and Jomba in Nyamasaria village, Kisumu on July 24 at 11:30PM. Kisumu East sub county Police commander James Musyimi alleges the duo were on polices radar over past criminal acts. According to police accounts, they received intel on Allan’s and John’s whereabouts, went to their homes and a shoot-out ensued fatally killing Allan and John. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to confirm the police accounts.
Name: Allan

Description: Police in Ruiru on Friday,July 23 killed two males at Githurai Kimbo, Kiambu county police commander Ali Nuno told Missing Voices. The police commander alleged the deceased refused to comply with officers’ orders to stop at 3:30AM on July 23, and a shoot-out ensured, resulting in the death of the two males. N.B. Missing Voices could not confirm the circumstances of the death.
Name: Unknown

Description: Police confimed killing two males in Eastleigh estate, Nairobi on July 22 at dawn. Police allege the males were suspected criminals. N.B. Missing Voices could not verify the details of the incident.

Description: On July 10, 2021, around 8PM, sources allege Mugai got arrested after getting into an argument with a bystander. Mugai called his mother to inform her of the arrest, thereafter his phone went off. He was found dead at the City Mortuary
Name: James Mugai

Perpetrator: Police officers from Buruburu and Kayole police stations.
Description: Police have confirmed shooting and killing of three males in Nairobi, Kayole on July 8. Police allege the males were suspected criminals. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances relating to the deaths.
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police officers from Buruburu and Kayole police stations.
Description: Police have confirmed shooting and killing of three males in Nairobi, Kayole on July 8. Police allege the males were suspected criminals. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances relating to the deaths.

Description: Police have confirmed shooting and killing of three males in Nairobi, Kayole on July 8. Police allege the males were suspected criminals. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances relating to the deaths.
Name: Unknown

Location: Homa Bay County,Suba South Subcounty,Laknyiero Trading Center
Perpetrator: Police officers from Magunga police station
Description: Caroline Achieng was allegedly attacked by police officers from Magunga police station on July 7,2021 at Laknyiero trading centre when they were enforcing curfew measures. According to the bar owner, the bar was closed as has guest rooms that are allowed to operate within the COVID regulations. An eye witness alleges the deceased was hit by a rungu by a police officer enforcing curfew regulations. The police took Achieng to Camillus Mission Hospital in Karungu, Sori town in Migori County where she was pronounced dead on arrival. Homa Bay County Police Commander Anthony Njeru stated Caroline was ordered to carry a crate of beer and walk towards the patrol officers, when she collapsed and died. The postmortem report disputed the police account, as pathologists Dr Awind Victor Omollo said Caroline died after being strangled and hit on the head with a blunt object. Caroline was an orphan who worked at the bar for 9 years.
Name: Caroline Achieng

Perpetrator: Police corporpolice corporal Caroline Kangogo attached to Nakuru police division is the prime suspect.
Description: DCI suspects that police corporal Caroline Kangogo shot Peter Ndwiga Njiru in the head at Dedamax Hotel in Juja using a Ceska pistol. It is alleged that the two of them booked the hotel room at 4:22, on July 5. A few days prior to Peter's murder,it is alleged that Caroline killed police constable John Owengo. Police officers announced a manhunt for Caroline who was evenutally found dead.
Name: Peter Ndwiga Njiru

Perpetrator: Police corporal Caroline Kangogo attached to Nakuru police division is the prime suspect.
Description: The media reported that the police constable John Ogweno was found murdered from a gunshot inside his car that was parked outside Kasarani police line in Nakuru. He was attached to Nakuru East police division. It is suspected that he died following a love triangle where police corporal Caroline Kangogo is the prime suspect. County Deputy Police Commander Joseph Tonui said Ogweno might have been killed around 2:30 AM on July 5. A few days after the murder of John, Caroline is suspected to have killed Peter Ndwiga. Police officers announced a manhunt for Caroline who was evenutally found dead.
Name: John Ogweno

Perpetrator: Police Officers from Dandora Police Station
Description: Star news reported that the deceased was shot in an alleged robbery by police officers. N.B. Missing Voices has not been able to verify the circumstances of the death
Name: Unknown

Perpetrator: Police Constable Kevin Amwayi attached to Kasarani Police Station DCI
Description: The media reported that police constable Kevin Amwayi attached to Kasarani DCI allegedly pushed Jackline Muthoni off the balcony from the fourth floor of a house in Ngumba estate. According to neighbours who responded to a loud bang, the officer threatened them with a gun before taking off. The relationship between Amwayi and Muthoni is unclear, as the media reported they were in an intimate relationship while her family denies such claims. Amwayi was arrested and handed over to Kasarani detectives. Amwayi claimed he did not kill Muthoni and that she jumped off fourth floor balcony. He is set to face murder charges.
Name: Jackline Muthoni

Description: According to media accounts, Bernard Wanjoh and Samuel Ngacha were in the company of four others, and were travelling from Ndaragwa to Narumoru. A witness told the press a grey Probox blocked them and it’s occupants lowered the window and corked a gun at them. Alleged police officers opened the front door and took the Bernard Wanjoh and Samuel Ngacha and drove off.
Name: Samuel Ngacha

Description: According to media accounts, Bernard Wanjoh and Samuel Ngacha were in the company of four others, and were travelling from Ndaragwa to Narumoru. A witness told the press a grey Probox blocked them and it’s occupants lowered the window and corked a gun at them. Alleged police officers opened the front door and took the Bernard Wanjoh and Samuel Ngacha and drove off.
Name: Bernard Wanjohi

Description: 34-year-old Isaac Mwangi who was traveling with his wife and their one-year-old daughter when two vehicles blocked their way and 6 men, suspected to be undercover police officers, took him away. Hours later, after Mwangi's wife made her way back to Narumoru, she was confronted with news of another abduction, this time of their employee Wilson Wairimu at a pub they own,media reported. He was allegedly kidnapped at around 7:30 PM.
Name: Isaac Mwangi

Description: 34-year-old Isaac Mwangi who was traveling with his wife and their one-year-old daughter when two vehicles blocked their way and 6 men, suspected to be undercover police officers, took him away. Hours later, after Mwangi's wife made her way back to Narumoru, she was confronted with news of another abduction, this time of their employee Wilson Wairimu at a pub they own,media reported. He was allegedly kidnapped at around 7:30 PM.
Name: Wilson Wairimu

Description: Anti-terror police unit (ATPU) officers arrested him on June 11 and charged him with resisting arrest. ATPU dropped the charge and brought up a new count relating to terrorism. On June 28 the court Kahawa Law Courts released him unconditionally, but he went missing until November 27.
Name: Taimur Kariuki Hussein

Description: It is reported, Eric Ochanda was arrested on June 23, 2021 for flouting curfew regulations and was fined 8,000 KES for a traffic offence.  Allegedly, he was unable to raise the money for the fine and was awaiting transfer to a prison facility. Police claim that Ochanda fell sick at the station and was confirmed dead on arrival at Marani sub county. Residents claimed foul play, as Ochanda was not sick prior to being arrested. Furthermore, the post-mortem indicated that Ochanda died from severe head trauma as a result of being hit with a blunt object.
Name: Eric Ochanda

Description: The deceased body was found by police officers in Denyenye area. The body exhibited gunshot wounds and torture marks. The family claimed that the deceased had been arrested on the 18/6/2021 at his home by men believed to be police officers.
Name: Salim Mwakarima

Description: Media reported that Darphine Morara, a standard six pupil at Marani Primary School, was shot dead on June 26 by police from Rioma police station during a protest by locals over the death of Eric Ochanda, a Bodaboda rider who died in police custody on June 26. The police shot at protesters in an attempt to disperse the crowd. Morara was walking home when she was hit by a stray bullet. She died at Kisii Teaching and Referral Hospital.
Name: Darphine Morara

Perpetrator: Police officers from Kasarani Police Station
Description: Reports indicate that a man was shot dead after allegedly committing a robbery.
Name: Unknown

Description: DCI reported the killing of 1 man during a anti-terror operation
Name: Unknown

Description: The Standard newspaper reported that Michael Munyalo Wambua OCS Garissa, shot dead Morris Kimathi Kaliunga on May 16 in Garissa, along Bula Sheikh Road. Allegedly Kimathi was shot in the back after a confrontation ensued at DRC Club.
Name: Morris Kimathi Kaliunga

Description: On May 13, 2021, Lapaja Topiwo, a 23-year-old security guard was killed at Red Square Hotel in Kayole, Nairobi. Reports state that Embakasi DCI Simon Mwongela allegedly shot Topiwo twice after an altercation. Witnesses state that Mwongela was dropped off at Red Square Hotel around 2AM. It is alleged that when staff attempted to check him in Mwongela become violent, drew his gun and threatened to shoot them. The staff hid in a hotel room and heard shots – learning after that Lapaja Topiwo had been shot dead. Mwongela was arrested after the incident.
Name: Lapaja Topiwo

Description: The deceased family  alleged that six (6) police officers who were on patrol on civilian using three Motorbikes without number plates  shot  dead Mr. Changawa at a place adjacent to Corner Bar at Mtomondoni in Mtwapa area. The deceased body was then taken to Coast General Hospital Mortuary for a postmortem. The matter is under investigation by the Independent Policing Oversight Authority.
Name: Juma Changawa

Description: The bodies of 18-year-old Nicholas Maithya Mutatha and 22-year-old Asman Kamau were found on Thika River on May 16th. Reports allege that the deceased were fishing at Thika River when they were arrested by two police officers from Ithanga Police Station, handcuffed together and thrown into the river – as a result of an anti-illicit brew operation. The police deny these reports and claim the two men met their fate while running away frm the police officers and the chief. Muthatha and Kamau’s parents deny the polices’ allegations. Muthatha and Kamau were described as hardworking and employed – Muthatha was a vegetable seller while Kamau was a boda-boda operator. The two were childhood friends and schooled together at Ngatho Primary School. According to sources, it was a coincidence that Maithya visited Kamau when Kamau was leaving his house to go fishing.
Name: Nicholas Maithya Mutatha

Description: DCI reported killing a man by the name of Kibe in an operation that took place on March 27. DCI alleges there was a shoot-out, and confirmed that no police officer was injured. N.B Missing Voices has not been able to confirm the circumstances surrounding the death
Name: Kibe

Description: A police operation on Saturday morning in Bombolulu, Mombasa left 5 men dead. Nyali sub-county police commander, Dr Daniel Masaba confirmed the killings stating the deceased were suspected robbers. After investigations, MUHURI dispute the police account of the deaths. It is reported that police officer abducted 5 men on March 17, 2021. Benedicto Kago Mugure was allegedly abducted by police officers at 11am, the officers  broke into his home, locked his house help in a room and disappeared with him. Nine officers allegedly abducted Newton Kibara at 3 pm in Mishomoroni, Kisauni and torched his motorbike. The families of the adducted reported their kins made missing person reports thereafter. Police killed Mugure, Kibara and 3 unidentified individuals in a residential room in Bombolulu, Kisauni. Investigators only found bullet marks on one wall in the room, disputing the police account
Name: Newton Kibara

Description: Around 5:45PM, reports allege that police officer Julius Mdachi got into an altercation with his seniors over differences pertaining to deployment. Mdachi shot 2 of his seniors, 1 was shot in the right thigh and sustained injuries, the other Sgt Amani Ali was also shot in the right thigh. Julius then proceeded to shoot himself. Both Julius and Sgt Amani Ali died from their injuries.
Name: Sgt Amani Ali

Status of Case: No Arrest / case was not reported
Description: Jarred was arrested by 5 policemen who used a probox KCP 631 Y and drive away with him later that evening he was taken to Mlango Kubwa Slum Soccer Stadium and shot dead
Name: Jarred Kasisi

Description: Mark Lumbasi Natala was arrested at Malaa market in Machakos and then died mysteriously in his cell. Police reported that he hung himself, but the autopsy report concluded he died from homicidal hanging after he was tortured. N.B. Homicidal hanging is when a person is unconscious and then hung to death
Name: Mark Lumbasi Natala

Description: He was allegedly abducted by unknown armed men believed to be police officers while in his home in Uwanja wa Ndege in Lungalunga
Name: Juma Wanini

Description: Reports allege that owner of a pub, Susan Nashir, asked a Wilfred Too, a police officer, to pay for his debt. Wilfred responded by fatally shooting Susan Nashiru. The incident took place in a pub at Kaakong shopping centre in Turkana.
Name: Susan Nashiru

Occupation: Police officer (in the Quick Response Unit)
Description: According to reports, Constable Lawrence Ewoi got into an argument with his colleague Achieng. Ewoi opened fire and fatally shot Achieng four times at close range. Police officers then killed Constable Lawrence Ewoi during  an operation. Lawrence Ewoi was in the Quick Response Unit (QRU)
Name: Constable Lawrence Ewoi
